article:
'Kipp's apparatus', also called 'Kipp generator', is an apparatus designed for
preparation of small volumes of gases. It was invented around 1844 by the Dutch
pharmacist Petrus Jacobus Kipp and widely used in chemical laboratories and for
demonstrations in schools into the second half of the 20th century.

It later fell out of use, at least in laboratories, because most gases then
became available in small gas cylinders. These industrial gases are much purer
and drier than those initially obtained from a Kipp apparatus without further
processing.
